pull.title: doc: Put PR template in comments
pull.body:
This prevents the common annoyance of the text being included into PRs
accidentally.

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

events.body: It will still be included in the pull (commented out) and then end up in the merge commit

> It will still be included in the pull (commented out) and then end up in the merge commit

I'll add an explicit comment to remove it. And if it's still a problem we can change github-merge.py to filter out HTML comments.

I think this is a lot better experience when submitting a PR, I still hope people will remove it, but even so it makes it easier to distinguish the commit message from the template stuff. Currently this text it simply pasted after and it's somewhat surprising.

events.message:
doc: Put PR template in comments

This prevents the common annoyance of the text being included into PRs
accidentally.

events.body: ACK 203a67d21f566634165531a7a75c3f8c9f9c9d6a - I make an effort to remove it whenever I see it in a PR.
